Although the definitions of indicators were 
standard, the differences in the primary data 
used to compute these indicators are substantial, 
and their direct comparison is not advisable. 
In Uganda, data were collected through the 
following methods:
  A Pregnancy Outcomes Monitoring Survey 
(POMS) in Comprehensive EmONC 
(CEmONC) facilities that collected individual-
level data on all pregnancy outcomes.
  An aggregation of all pregnancy outcomes 
data from non-CEmONCs (POM
